subject: Re: [junit] Categories: are they still experimental?
msgSnippet: In my opionion some very important features got merged just yesterday. People will use it more extensively and maybe there are still important things to add (I
messageBody:
In my opionion some very important features got merged just yesterday.
People will use it more extensively and maybe there are still important
things to add (I dont think of anything special). When changing the package
name some stuff could get renamed as @Category=>@Categories,
@Categories=>CategoryRunner or something like that.
@IncludeCategory=>IncludeCategories. Moving stuff from experimental is a
chance for last API-changes and it should happen when everything feels real
feature-complete.



2012/12/11 Matthew Farwell <matthew@...>

> **
>
>
> The subject says it all really. Are categories still considered
> experimental, and if not, should the package be moved out of
> org.junit.experimental.
>
> If they are still considered experimental, what would be required to move
> them to non-experimental?
>
> I would ask the same question for Theories, but, for me, Theories don't
> seem to be as mature.
>
> Matthew Farwell.
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
